trans-unit.source: You create a handler for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinqDataSource.ContextDisposing> event to perform clean-up that is specific to the data context object before the object is destroyed.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinqDataSourceDisposeEventArgs> object contains the data context object that is used when you are selecting, updating, inserting, or deleting data.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinqDataSource.ContextDisposing> event is raised during the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.Unload> event before the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinqDataSource> control disposes the context object.

The data context object is the type specified in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinqDataSource.ContextTypeName%2A> property or the type set to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinqDataSourceContextEventArgs.ObjectInstance%2A> of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinqDataSourceContextEventArgs> class.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinqDataSource> control interacts with a database, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinqDataSource.ContextTypeName%2A> property is set to the <xref:System.Data.Linq.DataContext> object that represents the database.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinqDataSource> control interacts with an in-memory data collection, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinqDataSource.ContextTypeName%2A> property is set to the object that contains the data collection.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinqDataSourceDisposeEventArgs"></xref> class.
The data context object to dispose.
Gets the data context object to dispose.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinqDataSourceDisposeEventArgs.ObjectInstance%2A> property contains the data context object that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinqDataSource> control uses for data operations.
You can use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinqDataSourceDisposeEventArgs.ObjectInstance%2A> property to retrieve the data context object if you want to examine the object before it is disposed.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinqDataSource> control interacts with a database, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinqDataSourceDisposeEventArgs.ObjectInstance%2A> property is set to the <xref:System.Data.Linq.DataContext> object that represents the database.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinqDataSource> control interacts with an in-memory data collection, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinqDataSourceDisposeEventArgs.ObjectInstance%2A> property is set to the object that contains the data collection.
An object that represents the data context.
